content.text:
Comprensión auditiva

Los ejercicios de comprensión auditiva evalúan la habilidad para escuchar y entender el inglés en contextos variados al emplear el idioma de forma espontánea. Esta parte contiene dos tipos de ejercicios. Para los primeros 22 ejercicios, escuchará las siguientes instrucciones:
Instrucciones: En esta parte, escuchará preguntas o enunciados en inglés seguidos de tres opciones, también en inglés.

Las preguntas o enunciados y las opciones se dirán solo una vez. Escuche cuidadosamente para poder entender porque no aparece nada escrito en el folleto de examen para estos ejercicios. Seleccione la mejor opción para cada pregunta o enunciado y oscurezca el espacio de la letra correspondiente en la hoja de respuestas

Los siguientes ejercicios consisten en 15 conversaciones breves entre dos personas, seguidas por 10 parlamentos breves. Para estos 23 ejercicios, escuchará las siguientes instrucciones:

Instrucciones: Las conversaciones y parlamentos no están impresos en su folleto de examen. Usted los oirá solo una vez; por lo tanto, escuche cuidadosamente para poder entenderlos. Las preguntas o enunciados breves y las posibles respuestas para las conversaciones y parlamentos breves aparecen impresos en su folleto de examen. content.class: bg-slate-100 rounded p-3 my-2 max-w-3xl mx-auto

content.textual:
*She loves reading books.\n She enjoys going to the library.\n She often visits bookstores.
Choose the alternative that is closest in meaning to the following sentences. 
She loves reading books, and she enjoys going to the library, but she often visits bookstores.
 She loves reading books and enjoys going to the library, often visiting bookstores.
 She loves reading books and enjoys going to the library but often visits bookstores.
 She loves reading books and enjoys going to the library, so she often visits bookstores.
c

*I wanted to go to the concert.\nI had to work late.\nI missed the show.
Choose the alternative that is closest in meaning to the following sentences. 
I wanted to go to the concert, I had to work late, and I missed the show.
I wanted to go to the concert but had to work late, so I missed the show.
I wanted to go to the concert and I had to work late, but I missed the show.
 I wanted to go to the concert, I had to work late so I missed the show.
b

*He enjoys hiking.\nHe loves camping.\nHe often goes fishing with friends.\nHe appreciates the great outdoors.
Choose the alternative that is closest in meaning to the following sentences.
He enjoys hiking, loves camping, often goes fishing with friends, and appreciates the great outdoors.
He enjoys hiking, loves camping and often goes fishing with friends, and appreciates the great outdoors.
He enjoys hiking and loves camping, often goes fishing with friends, and appreciates the great outdoors.
 He enjoys hiking, loves camping often goes fishing with friends and appreciates the great outdoors.
a

*The weather was perfect.\nWe decided to have a picnic.\nWe packed sandwiches, fruits, and drinks.\nWe spent the day in the park.
Choose the alternative that is closest in meaning to the following sentences. 
The weather was perfect, so we decided to have a picnic and packed sandwiches, fruits, and drinks and spent the day in the park.
The weather was perfect, we decided to have a picnic and packed sandwiches, fruits, and drinks, spent the day in the park.
The weather was perfect so we decided to have a picnic, packed sandwiches, fruits, and drinks, and spent the day in the park.
The weather was perfect, so we decided to have a picnic, packed sandwiches, fruits, and drinks, and spent the day in the park.
d

*She had a long day at work.\nShe decided to take a relaxing bath.\nShe read a book in the tub.
Choose the alternative that is closest in meaning to the following sentences.
She had a long day at work, but she decided to take a relaxing bath, and she read a book while soaking in the tub.
She had a long day at work, decided to take a relaxing bath, and read a book while she was in the tub.
She had a long day at work, so she decided to read a book while she was taking a relaxing bath. 
She had a long day at work, yet she decided to take a relaxing bath, she read a book while soaking in the tub.
c

*John wanted to go hiking.\nHis friends preferred to stay indoors.\nThey agreed on a nature-themed board game night.
Choose the alternative that is closest in meaning to the following sentences. 
John wanted to go hiking, his friends preferred to stay indoors, yet they agreed on a nature-themed board game night.
John wanted to go hiking, his friends preferred to stay indoors, so they agreed on a nature-themed board game night.
John wanted to go hiking, but his friends preferred to stay indoors, they agreed on a nature-themed board game night.
John wanted to go hiking, his friends preferred to stay indoors, however they compromised on a nature-themed board game night. 
c

*The rain started to pour.\nWe found shelter.\nWe got completely soaked.
Choose the alternative that is closest in meaning to the following sentences.
The rain started to pour, we found shelter, and we got completely soaked.
The rain started to pour, we found shelter, so we got completely soaked.
The rain started to pour, so we found shelter, and we got completely soaked.
The rain started to pour, we found shelter, yet we got completely soaked.
d

*She passed the test.\nShe scored the highest mark in the class.
Choose the alternative that is closest in meaning to the following sentences. 
She passed the test not only but also scored the highest marks in the class.
Not only she passed the test but also scored the highest marks in the class.
She not only passed the test but also scored the highest marks in the class.
She passed the test and also scored the highest marks in the class.
c


*The students enjoyed the field trip.\nThe teacher enjoyed the field trip.\nThey learned about nature.
Choose the alternative that is closest in meaning to the following sentences.
Both the teacher and the students enjoyed the field trip and they learned a lot about nature.
Both the teacher and the students enjoyed the field trip and learned a lot about nature.
Both the teacher enjoyed the field trip and the students learned a lot about nature.
They enjoyed the field trip both and learned a lot about nature.
b

*The movie theater was not open.\nThe restaurant was not open.\nWe had to find another place to go.
Choose the alternative that is closest in meaning to the following sentences. 
Neither the movie theater nor the restaurant was open, so we had to find another place to go.
We had to find another place to go, neither the movie theater nor the restaurant was open.
Neither the movie theater nor the restaurant was open, but we had to find another place to go.
We had to find another place to go, and neither the movie theater nor the restaurant was open.
a

*The concert tickets were expensive.\nThey decided to go.\nThey didn't regret it.
Choose the alternative that is closest in meaning to the following sentences.
The concert tickets were expensive, they decided to go, although they didn't regret it.
Although he concert tickets were expensive, but they decided to go, and they didn't regret it.
The concert tickets were expensive, they decided to go, they didn't regret it.
Although the concert wickets were expensive, they decided to go, and they didn’t regret it.
d

content.text: The world of technology is constantly evolving. (1) ____, new innovations are introduced for almost every day, reshaping the way we live and work.  Furthermore, smartphones (2)_____________ an indispensable part of our lives, providing us with access to information and communication on the go. (3) _____, the importance of cybersecurity cannot be overstated, as cyber threats are becoming increasingly sophisticated.  (4) Moreover, individuals and organizations must prioritize their online security to safeguard sensitive information. (5) Contrastingly, online education has gained popularity, allowing students _____ a wide range of courses from the comfort of their homes. (6) _____, technology has also raised concerns about privacy and data protection. (7) _____, it is crucial for everyone to stay informed and take necessary precautions in the digital age.
content.name: toIs

content.textual:
Which would be the most appropriate word to begin sentence 1? 
Therefore
In conclusion
However
Nonetheless
A

Which words complete the gap in sentence 2?
are becoming
is becoming
has become
have become
D

Which would be the most appropriate word to begin sentence 3? 
Consequently
Meanwhile
Moreover
However
D

Which of the following is INCORRECTLY used?
The word “for” in sentence 1
The word “us” in sentence 2
The word “cannot” in sentence 3
The word “their” in sentence 4
A

Which would be the most appropriate word to begin sentence 6? 
Furthermore
Therefore
Nonetheless
However
A

Which words complete the gap in sentence 5?
accessing
have accessed
have access
to access
D

Which would be the most appropriate word to begin sentence 7? 
Consequently
Additionally
In conclusion
Rarely
C

What is the purpose of sentence 7?
To raise awareness on the importance of being informed. 
To summarize the  information from the text. 
To contrast ideas from the text. 
To give facts about the digital age. 
A

content.text: Engaging in physical activity outdoors provides numerous
content.name: CUns

content.text: advantages for both physical and mental well-being. When
content.name: 8E32

content.text: compared to indoor exercise, outdoor workouts offer a
content.name: sPKJ

content.text: refreshing change of scenery, motivating individuals to stay
content.name: 2BJr

content.text: active.
content.name: bNWh

content.text: Breathing fresh air while jogging in a park or cycling through
content.name: PW2N

content.text: scenic trails not only boosts cardiovascular health but also
content.name: IgW5

content.text: enhances mood. Exposure to natural sunlight aids in the
content.name: jwVD

content.text: production of vitamin D, it is crucial for strong bones and a
content.name: sw9t

content.text: strong immune system.
content.name: DcVS

content.text: Furthermore, outdoor exercise promotes social interaction.
content.name: n9eM

content.text: Parks and recreational areas often become hubs for
content.name: pvnb

content.text: community gatherings, encouraging individuals to connect
content.name: SIhS

content.text: with others while pursuing fitness goals.
content.name: 7Xmq

content.text: To maximize the benefits of outdoor exercise, consider
content.name: Rn36

content.text: activities like hiking, swimming, or yoga in a park. However,
content.name: GF7Z

content.text: it's essential to stay hydrated, protect yourself from excessive
content.name: JVhk

content.text: sun exposure, and be mindful of safety precautions.
content.name: CuI2

content.name: D0Kn

content.name: h8TY

content.text: Whether you prefer a brisk walk in the park or an
content.name: aVsq

content.name: ofjf

What aspects of one’s life can outdoor exercise improve?
Physical and mental well-being.
Sun exposure. 
Stay hydrated.
Fitness goals.

How does outdoor exercise contribute to better health?
Provides opportunities to walk in the park.
It improves production of Vitamin D. 
It encourages sun exposure. 
It boosts community gatherings. 	
B

How do outdoor activities benefit social interaction?
They motivate individuals to stay active. 
Open spaces become meeting points for meeting new people.
Parks and open gyms are beautiful. 
A forest can promote healthy habits. 
B

What does the author recommend about outdoor safety?
It is not necessary to take precautions. 
Safety precautions are very strict.
Safety precautions are only needed indoors. 
It is essential to take safety precautions.

These physical activities are mentioned in the text EXCEPT?
Hiking.
Yoga.
Swimming.
Weightlifting.
D

What is the main purpose of the text?
To promote parks and open gyms. 
To give safety measures for outdoor activities. 
To inform about the benefits of outdoor activities.
To show the benefit of indoor activities. 
C

In line 1, “both” refers to
Individuals and communities.
Numerous advantages.
Physical and mental well-being.
Outdoors and indoors. 		
C

In line 9, “it” refers to 
Vitamin D.
Natural sunlight.
Strong bones. 
Immune system. 
A

Because it involves exercising outdoors. 
Because it offers physical, mental, and social advantages.
Because it focuses only on physical health.
Because it includes social interaction.
B

Why does the text mention that outdoor exercise promotes social interaction?
To discourage outdoor exercise.
To emphasize the importance of solitude.
To highlight one of its advantages.
To criticize people who exercise outdoors.
C

content.text: On a cold winter's morning, Emily received an unexpected
content.name: 6Fnr

content.text: package at her doorstep. It was a small, nondescript box with
content.name: yii2

content.text: her name rapidly inscribed across it. Intrigued and a little
content.name: LxND

content.text: cautious, she brought it inside and carefully opened it. Inside
content.name: dCJB

content.text: was a beautiful, antique pocket watch.
content.name: AHlw

content.text: As she held the watch in her hand, a flood of memories
content.name: AiRg

content.text: rushed back. She remembered her grandfather, a kind and
content.name: Y3dc

content.text: gentle man who had passed away when she was just a child.
content.name: n549

content.text: This pocket watch had once belonged to him. She thought it
content.name: FstE

content.text: was lost forever, but here it was, miraculously returned to
content.name: Ltmv

content.text: her.
content.name: v8QS

content.text: Attached to the watch was a note that read, "To my dearest
content.name: QVYP

content.text: Emily, may this watch remind you of the timeless love and
content.name: eiH0

content.text: memories we shared. - Grandfather."
content.name: XZ4u

content.text: Tears filled Emily's eyes as she realized the significance of
content.name: JSUq

content.text: this unexpected gift. It was a symbol of the bond she had
content.name: trZk

content.text: with her grandfather and a reminder of the wisdom he had
content.name: Q37a

content.text: passed on to her.
content.name: w9MG

content.text: As she held the watch and listened to its rhythmic ticking,
content.name: 5G9w

content.text: she knew that it was more than just a timepiece;
content.name: 6etR

content.text: it was a connection to her past and a source of comfort in the
content.name: mgvc

content.text: present.
content.name: i5vk

content.text: Emily wore the pocket watch every day, and whenever she
content.name: iIXg

content.text: looked at it, she felt her grandfather's presence, as if he was
content.name: KsgV

content.text: still by her side, offering his guidance and love.
content.name: 20sw
GACO

morning
package

Because it reminded her childhood and her grandfather's love.					
D

The gift.
Comfort.
Present. 
A

Receiving surprise gifts can brighten one’s day.
The significance of family connections.
The mystery in the package.
The value of old items. 
B

content.text: In the ever-evolving world of social media, the landscape is
content.name: WHrp

content.text: constantly shifting, with trends that can sweep through the
content.name: hP3o

content.text: digital realm like wildfire. Recent events in the social media
content.name: w9o2

content.text: sphere have sparked conversations about its impact on our
content.name: wIRs

content.text: lives and the broader digital revolution.
content.name: sAvy

content.text: One prominent trend making waves is the rise of short-form
content.name: B7xV

content.text: video content. Platforms like TikTok have taken the world by
content.name: w24b

content.text: storm, with users sharing creative and engaging videos in 60
content.name: 5rU6

content.text: seconds or less. This shift towards shorter, more consumable
content.name: R7Hd

content.text: content reflects our fast-paced lives and the need for
content.name: BADs

content.text: quick, entertaining distractions.
content.name: RaUz

content.text: However, concerns about privacy and data security continue
content.name: 4C3L

content.text: to raise questions and worries. Recent data breaches, or
content.name: AnQn

content.text: exposing personal data,  and controversies involving social
content.name: sfDg

content.text: media giants have raised questions about how our personal
content.name: PRdn

content.text: information is handled online. Users are becoming
content.name: VycZ

content.text: increasingly aware of the importance of protecting their
content.name: LXNu

content.text: digital footprint.
content.name: T5Wd

content.text: Social media's role in shaping public opinion and
content.name: S4Gf

content.text: disseminating information has also come under scrutiny. The
content.name: aMb3

content.text: spread of misinformation and "fake news" on these
content.name: cbow

content.text: platforms has led to calls for greater accountability and
content.name: 2nAZ

content.text: fact-checking mechanisms.
content.name: gm5k

content.text: On a positive note, social media has become a powerful tool
content.name: m9XL

content.text: for activism and social change. Movements like
content.name: RAvI

content.text: #BlackLivesMatter and #MeToo have gained traction and
content.name: Qff9

content.text: sparked real-world action through the digital mobilization of
content.name: W0aP

content.text: voices.
content.name: NGpw

content.text: Navigating this complex digital landscape requires digital
content.name: jz2b

content.text: literacy and critical thinking skills. Users must learn to discern
content.name: JDuc

content.text: credible sources from unreliable ones and understand
content.name: sfDs

content.text: the implications of their online actions.
content.name: ai3L

content.text: As social media continues to reshape our world, it's clear that
content.name: 24DX

content.text: these platforms are here to stay. However, our ability to
content.name: ebFi

content.text: harness their potential for positive change while mitigating
content.name: XURh

content.text: their negative effects will be crucial in the ongoing
content.name: jYPu

content.text: #DigitalRevolution.
content.name: tE60
3BMH

In line 4, “its” refers to
Social media.
Conversations. 
Digital Revolution.
Wildfire. 
A

What is the main topic of the news article?
The rise of short-form video content.
 Privacy concerns on social media.
The impact of social media on life. 
Social media's role in shaping public opinion.
C

What trend has been prominent in the world of social media recently?
The spread of misinformation.
The rise of long-form video content.
The popularity of text-based posts.
Short-form video content on platforms like TikTok.
A

What is the concern related to data security on social media?
Users are sharing too much personal information.
Users are not using social media enough.
Data breaches and mishandling of personal information.
Data on social media is too secure.
D

In line 16, “their” refers to
Digital footprint.
Users. 
Information.
Social Media.
B

What is one potential consequence of the rise of short-form video content on social media platforms?
Decreased user engagement.
Increased data security.
A shift towards longer videos.
A need for quicker, more entertaining content.
D

content.text: Animals inhabit nearly every corner of our planet, from the
content.name: Ord5

content.text: icy depths of Antarctica to the scorching deserts of the
content.name: XZB5

content.text: Sahara. Their remarkable ability to adapt to diverse
content.name: qBab

content.text: environments is evidence of the wonders of nature. In this
content.name: vEwm

content.text: informative text, we'll delve into the fascinating world of
content.name: c7El

content.text: animal adaptations.
content.name: h12L

content.text: The world's ecosystems vary greatly, and animals have
content.name: DYvN

content.text: evolved specific traits to thrive in their respective habitats.
content.name: HHzm

content.text: For instance, polar bears have adapted to the harsh Arctic
content.name: pLDR

content.text: environment with thick layers of blubber and fur to keep
content.name: Lb0b

content.text: warm, while camels possess specialized humps that store fat
content.name: g8P5

content.text: and help them survive the dry conditions of the desert.
content.name: 32Eh

content.text: Adaptations often serve as survival strategies. Chameleons,
content.name: UH8Z

content.text: with their ability to change color, blend seamlessly into their
content.name: vSc4

content.text: surroundings, avoiding predators and ambushing prey.
content.name: Ufj0

content.text: The armadillo's hard, protective shell acts as armor against
content.name: 9LkO

content.text: potential threats, allowing it to curl into a ball when
content.name: wk7g

content.text: threatened.
content.name: xwiT

content.text: Animals have developed unique feeding adaptations based
content.name: Aruj

content.text: on their diets. Hummingbirds, with their long, slender
content.name: QP4A

content.text: bills and rapid wingbeats, can access nectar from deep within
content.name: UFl6

content.text: flowers. Woodpeckers have strong, chisel-like beaks for
content.name: FSzD

content.text: drilling into trees to find insects.
content.name: bPHf

content.text: Migration is another incredible adaptation. Many bird
content.name: 8HEi

content.text: species, such as the Arctic tern, embark on long-distance
content.name: RU41

content.text: journeys to find suitable breeding and feeding grounds. Some
content.name: jZoa

content.text: sea turtles travel thousands of miles across oceans to lay
content.name: ogp7

content.text: their eggs on specific beaches.
content.name: migK

content.text: Aquatic environments present their own challenges. Dolphins
content.name: Ghzy

content.text: have streamlined bodies and powerful tails for swift
content.name: iM7H

content.text: swimming, while penguins use their flipper-like wings to glide
content.name: TXWW

content.text: through water with remarkable agility.
content.name: aGdG

content.text: Sensory adaptations enhance an animal's ability to navigate
content.name: CuPk

content.text: its environment. Bats rely on echolocation to locate prey in
content.name: aNVw

content.text: the dark, while the keen sense of smell in dogs helps
content.name: 4rdo

content.text: them track scents over long distances.
content.name: fZG0

content.text: Animal adaptations are evidence of the remarkable diversity
content.name: Hs7N

content.text: of life on Earth. They enable species to survive and thrive in
content.name: TOFw

content.text: environments as extreme as the deep ocean and as
content.name: mjg4

content.text: delicate as a rainforest canopy. Understanding these
content.name: iRIo

content.text: adaptations not only deepens our appreciation for the
content.name: Tm8v

content.text: natural world but also emphasizes the importance of
content.name: kN86

content.text: preserving these ecosystems for future generations.
content.name: WhOw
T9mR

What is the main idea of the text?
The habits of camels in the desert.
The importance of migration for animals.
How animals adapt to their environments.
The world's diverse ecosystems.

Chameleon's color-changing ability.
Hummingbird's long bill.
Tiger's stripes.
D

To store food.
To camouflage.
For protection. 
D

Animals.
Adaptations.
Environment.
Nature. 
A

To have more abilities.
To find a mate. 
To find their habitat.
To move around. 
D

In line 41, “our” refers to
The animals.
The adaptations. 
The author and the reader.
The ecosystems. 
B

What can be inferred about animal adaptations?
Animals live in diverse ecosystems.
Animals have unique adaptations to thrive in their environments.
Habitats are essential for animal survival.
Some animals have protective shells.
B

Which of the following best summarizes the text?
Animals live in diverse ecosystems.
Animals have unique adaptations to thrive in their environments.
Habitats are essential for animal survival.
Some animals have protective shells.
B
